intro: Tococa didymophysca, commonly known as the Amazonian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and elliptical leaves with a waxy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforests. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for commercial use.
